required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Observational Study of Ibrutinib Use in CLL
clinical_study.official_title: Analysis of Ibrutinib Efficacy and Safety in the Treatment of Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia Patients in Routine Clinical Practice

lead_sponsor.agency: Federal State Budgetary Institution, V. A. Almazov Federal North-West Medical Research Centre, of the Ministry of Health

clinical_study.source: Federal State Budgetary Institution, V. A. Almazov Federal North-West Medical Research Centre, of the Ministry of Health

brief_summary.textblock: IB-RU-SCOPE is a "routine-clinical practice" oriented cohort observational study of ibrutinib efficacy and safety in approx. 70 patients with chronic lymphocytic leukemia in the Russian Federation

detailed_description.textblock: Ibrutinib is approved in Russia for treatment of CLL patients both in first line and in relapsed/refractory setting. There is a discrepancy in reported ibrutinib toxicity profile, efficacy and tolerability between registrational clinical trials and observational studies, which to some extent may be explained by patient selection in the former. IB-RU-SCOPE is a first "routine-clinical practice" oriented cohort observational study of ibrutinib in CLL in Russia. The study is designed to include all previously untreated and relapsed/refractory CLL patients older than 18 years with active disease, who have recently started or are about to start ibrutinib (both as monotherapy and in combination), and to follow them to a minimum of 18 and a maximum of 36 months. The study is being conducted in approx. 10 Russian hematological centers and aims to include approx. 70 CLL patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Frequency of adverse events (including serious adverse events)
primary_outcome.description: In order to evaluate ibrutinib toxicity, all adverse events (AEs), which will occur in study patients, will be collected and analyzed. CTCAE v4.03 criteria and iwCLL criteria will be used for grading of non-hematologic and hematologic AEs, respectively. Frequencies of AEs of all grades will be calculated and reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Average duration of treatment with ibrutinib
primary_outcome.description: Time from the first dose of ibrutinib to treatment discontinuation (e.g. due to AEs or CLL progression) will be measured in all study patients. Mean value will be then calculated and reported. This will provide a context, necessary for interpetation of other results (such as toxicity and efficacy measures). results (such as toxicity and efficacy measures).

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients requiring dose reduction and/or discontinuation of therapy due to causes not related to CLL progression.
primary_outcome.description: In order to evaluate tolerability of ibrutinib in CLL patients in routine clinical practice, all cases of ibrutinib dose reduction and/or drug discontinuation due to causes not related to CLL progression will be collected and analyzed. Proportion of patients, not tolerating full dose of ibrutinib will be then calculated and reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Dynamics of QoL indicators assessed by EORTC QLQ-C30 (version 3.0) questionnaire during treatment
primary_outcome.description: Patients will complete EORTC QLQ-C30 (version 3.0) questionnaires every 3 months during the sudy. Data from questionnaires will be subsequently extracted as numerical values and analyzed according to recommended protocol to estimate changes in patient's quality of life (QoL) during treatment. As a result, either improvement, decline or no change in QoL will be shown

biospec_descr.textblock: Whole blood. Biobanking of whole blood specimens, collected for routine tests (if available, under separate biobanking informed consent)

study_pop.textblock: Males and females with confirmed diagnosis of CLL treated with Ibrutinib

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Federal State Budgetary Institution, V. A. Almazov Federal North-West Medical Research Centre, of the Ministry of Health
